company_context: EcoTech Solutions is a mid‑size SaaS provider for renewable‑energy asset management. The Customer Success department is organized into three squads (Onboarding, Support, and Retention). The weekly newsletter is produced by the Support Squad (team name: Renewable Energy Support Team) to keep agents, product managers, and sales operations informed about recent wins, product tweaks, and key performance metrics.
meeting_event_details: Issue 42 deadline: Thursday, 21 Nov 2025, 12:00 PM EST (content final). Publication: Friday, 22 Nov 2025, 9:00 AM EST on the internal SharePoint News portal. No physical meeting; coordination occurs via Microsoft Teams channel #support‑newsletter and the shared Outlook calendar.
stakeholders: Maria Lopez – Senior Content Specialist (Content Creator). Responsible for drafting all copy, sourcing images, and assembling the newsletter in the company template.
James Patel – Support Team Lead (Reviewer). Reviews copy for accuracy, validates metrics, and ensures compliance with support policies.
Lena Kim – Director of Customer Success (Approver). Gives final sign‑off, checks alignment with corporate messaging, and authorises distribution.
Tyler Reed – UX Designer (Optional Contributor). Provides alt‑text and accessibility checks for any graphics.
Sofia Alvarez – Marketing Operations Analyst (Distribution Owner). Schedules the publish job on SharePoint and notifies the mailing list.
deliverables: Draft newsletter (Word/Google Docs) by Tuesday, 19 Nov 2025, 5:00 PM EST.
Reviewed version with tracked changes by Wednesday, 20 Nov 2025, 11:00 AM EST.
Final approved PDF/HTML newsletter file by Thursday, 21 Nov 2025, 12:00 PM EST.
Publish schedule entry and distribution email ready for Friday 9:00 AM EST release.
success_criteria: Newsletter published on time (by 9:00 AM EST Friday).
Zero compliance issues (GDPR, accessibility WCAG 2.1 AA).
Word count ≤ 800 words and ≤ 4 content sections.
Open‑rate ≥ 45 % and click‑through rate ≥ 12 % measured after 48 hours.
Positive feedback from at least 3 team leads in the post‑issue survey.
constraints: Planning horizon is T‑7 (content must be ready 7 days before publication).
Budget for external images is $0 – only internal assets may be used.
All copy must use the approved EcoTech brand voice guide (version 3.2).
Newsletter must be fully accessible: alt‑text for images, proper heading hierarchy, and color contrast ≥ 4.5:1.
Dependency on the weekly metrics report, which is delivered by the Data Analytics team every Wednesday 10:00 AM EST.
workback_prompt: Generate a detailed work‑back plan for the EcoTech Weekly Support Newsletter (Issue 42) described above. Start from the final publication deadline (Friday, 22 Nov 2025, 9:00 AM EST) and work backwards to the first task, covering all required tasks, owners, estimated durations, dependencies, and key milestones. Include buffer time for review cycles, compliance checks, and unexpected delays. Present the plan in a table format with columns: Task, Owner, Start Date/Time, End Date/Time, Duration, Dependencies, and Notes.

company_context: EcoTech Solutions is a mid‑size SaaS provider for renewable‑energy asset management. The GreenPulse Customer Success Team (15 members) sits in the Customer Success department and reports to the Director of Customer Success. The weekly newsletter keeps the CS team, product managers, support, and sales leadership aligned on wins, upcoming releases, and key metrics.
meeting_event_details: Monday, November 25, 2025, 09:00 – 09:30 AM PST, virtual meeting on Zoom (Meeting ID: 842 931 274). The meeting is used to confirm the editorial calendar for the upcoming newsletter and to capture any last‑minute items.

stakeholders.name: Emily Chen
stakeholders.responsibility: Drafts all newsletter copy, assembles graphics, and builds the Google Doc draft.

stakeholders.name: Raj Patel
stakeholders.responsibility: Reviews draft for accuracy, relevance, and tone; provides feedback by Wednesday 10:00 AM PST.

stakeholders.name: Lena Morales
stakeholders.responsibility: Approves final version; gives sign‑off no later than Thursday 12:00 PM PST.

stakeholders.name: Mia Torres
stakeholders.responsibility: Ensures brand‑compliant visuals and alt‑text; delivers assets by Wednesday 09:00 AM PST.

stakeholders.name: Javier Gomez
stakeholders.responsibility: Sets up UTM parameters and post‑send tracking; validates tracking code by Thursday 02:00 PM PST.

deliverables: Draft newsletter in Google Docs (Word count ≤ 800, includes sections: Wins & Highlights, Upcoming Feature Releases, Customer Spotlight, Metrics Snapshot).
Final HTML email built in Mailchimp using the approved EcoTech brand template.
Analytics tracking sheet with UTM parameters and KPI baseline.
success_criteria: Newsletter sent to the CS distribution list by Friday, November 29, 2025, 09:00 AM PST.
Open rate ≥ 45% and click‑through rate ≥ 12% measured 48 hours after send.
Zero GDPR or accessibility compliance issues (all images have alt‑text, unsubscribe link present).
Positive feedback from ≥ 80% of recipients in the post‑send survey (rating 4/5 or higher).
All stakeholder approvals completed on time (no later than Thursday 12:00 PM PST).
constraints: Planning horizon is T‑7: all content must be finalized within 7 days of the send date.
No external design spend – all graphics must be created using internal design assets.
Must use the approved EcoTech brand template; any deviation requires senior sign‑off.
Dependent on product release schedule – the Upcoming Feature Releases section can only include features that have been officially announced by the Product team by Wednesday.
Email size must stay under 100 KB to ensure deliverability.
workback_prompt: Create a detailed workback plan for the 'Weekly GreenPulse Customer Success Newsletter' at EcoTech Solutions. The plan should start from the send date (Friday, November 29, 2025, 09:00 AM PST) and work backwards, covering all tasks, owners, durations, dependencies, and milestones needed to meet the deadline and success criteria outlined in the scenario. Include steps for content drafting, stakeholder reviews, design asset creation, approval workflow, email build, testing, analytics setup, and post‑send reporting. Highlight any risk mitigation actions for the constraints (budget, compliance, and product‑release dependencies).

scenario_name: DataPulse Marketing Analytics Weekly Newsletter (Week of Nov 18 2025)
company_context: DataPulse Inc. is a mid‑size SaaS company (≈850 employees) that provides real‑time data‑visualization platforms for retail brands. The Marketing Analytics Team (15 members) sits in the Marketing Department and reports to the VP of Marketing, Maya Patel. The team produces a weekly internal newsletter to surface campaign performance, upcoming experiments, and cross‑team learnings for the broader Marketing organization (≈120 readers).
meeting_event_details: Newsletter publishing meeting – Friday, 15 Nov 2025, 10:30 AM – 11:00 AM (30 min) via Microsoft Teams (recorded). The meeting is used to confirm final copy, graphics, and distribution list before the newsletter goes live at 12:00 PM the same day. The next edition will be published Monday, 18 Nov 2025 at 12:00 PM.

stakeholders.name: Lena Gomez
stakeholders.responsibility: Collects contributions, writes editorial intro, assembles layout in Canva, and uploads final PDF to the internal portal.

stakeholders.name: Ravi Singh
stakeholders.responsibility: Reviews the 'Performance Snapshot' section for accuracy, validates charts, and ensures compliance with data‑privacy guidelines.

stakeholders.name: Maya Patel
stakeholders.responsibility: Gives final sign‑off on tone, strategic messaging, and any announcements that affect the whole Marketing org.

stakeholders.name: Jenna Lee
stakeholders.responsibility: Creates visual assets (header banner, infographics) and ensures brand guidelines are met.

stakeholders.name: Tom Alvarez
stakeholders.responsibility: Manages distribution list in the internal newsletter platform (Workplace by Meta) and tracks open‑rate metrics.

deliverables: Weekly Newsletter PDF (2‑page, 1,200 words max) ready for upload by 12:00 PM Friday, 15 Nov 2025.
Accompanying HTML version for the intranet portal (optional, for accessibility).
Performance Snapshot data file (Excel) with source links attached for reviewer reference.
Distribution report template (pre‑filled with recipient list) for Tom to upload.
Post‑publish analytics deck (open rate, click‑through, feedback) to be shared in the next Monday stand‑up.
success_criteria: Newsletter published on schedule (by 12:00 PM Friday).
Zero data‑accuracy errors flagged by the reviewer.
Brand‑compliance score ≥ 95 % (checked against the internal brand checklist).
Open rate ≥ 78 % of the Marketing org and click‑through on at least one featured link ≥ 30 %.
All stakeholder sign‑offs captured in the shared Teams channel before the publishing meeting.
constraints: T‑7 planning horizon – all content must be submitted to Lena by 12:00 PM Thursday, 14 Nov 2025.
Budget: No external design tools may be purchased; only Canva Enterprise (already licensed) can be used.
Data privacy: Any customer‑level data must be aggregated to the campaign level before inclusion.
Dependency: Ravi’s review cannot start until the raw performance data file is uploaded to the shared OneDrive folder (deadline 9:00 AM Thursday).
Technical: The newsletter platform only accepts PDFs under 2 MB; graphics must be optimized accordingly.
workback_prompt: Generate a detailed workback plan for the 'DataPulse Marketing Analytics Weekly Newsletter (Week of Nov 18 2025)' scenario. Include all tasks, owners, start/end dates, and dependencies, working backwards from the final publishing deadline of Friday, 15 Nov 2025 at 12:00 PM. Account for the T‑7 planning horizon, stakeholder sign‑offs, data‑privacy checks, and the constraints listed.
